required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluating the Use of Sublingual Sufentanil in Patients With Suboxone Treatment
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluating the Use of Sublingual Sufentanil in Patients With Suboxone Treatment Who Are Undergoing Ambulatory Surgery- a Case Series

brief_summary.textblock: In this case, series, the investigators are testing the hypothesis that sublingual sufentanil (Dsuvia) will improve postoperative pain management in the PACU in ambulatory surgery patients taking Suboxone.

primary_outcome.description: Evaluate the total amount of morphine equivalence (MME) in the perioperative period (defined as combined total opioid used intra-op and in the PACU).

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to fit to discharge from the PACU
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During stay in PACU, up until discharge from PACU
secondary_outcome.description: How much time did subject take to become considered 'fit to discharge?'

secondary_outcome.time_frame: PACU stay to 24 hours post hospital discharge
secondary_outcome.description: Look at how many additional opioids subject needed.

secondary_outcome.measure: time to take the first additional opioid
secondary_outcome.description: How soon did subject require an additional opioid?

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During PACU stay, up until discharge from PACU
secondary_outcome.description: Make note of nausea, vomiting, itching, hypotension, dizziness that occur while in PACU

secondary_outcome.measure: adverse events post discharge from PACU
secondary_outcome.description: Make note of nausea, vomiting, itching, hypotension, dizziness that occur within 24 hours after being discharged from PACU

arm_group.description: Subjects will receive dose of Dsuvia 30mcg SL (1st dose) after induction but before first incision. Post-operatively, if subject rates pain higher than 4 out of 10, subject will receive a second dose of Dsuvia 30mcg SL. If 30 minutes after second dose, subject rates pain higher than 4 out of 10, subject will receive ibuprofen 800mg IV. If 60 minutes after second dose, subject rates pain higher than 7 out of 10, subject will receive hydromorphone 0.4 mg IV.
Subjects will be receive routine standard of care.

intervention.description: Subject will receive up to 2 doses of Dsuvia. The first dose will be intra-op and the second dose will be post-op (if needed)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- • Age range 18-100 years
- Currently taking Suboxone
- ASA physical score 1-3
- Able to provide a signed informed consent
- General anesthesia (either endotracheal intubation or laryngeal mask airway) without the use of regional anesthesia
Exclusion Criteria:
- • Known allergic reactions to Dsuvia and its excipients
- Severe respiratory illness including exacerbation of asthma attack
- Significant intraoperative hemodynamic instability
- Use of Regional anesthesia techniques
